required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: VitalScan MCG Rule-out Multi-centre Pivotal Study - US
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Multi-centre Observational Study to Validate the Diagnostic Accuracy of a Transportable Magnetocardiograph Device for Acute Coronary Syndrome (ACS), Focusing on Rule-out Capability, in Patients Who Present to the Emergency Department With Chest Pain Symptoms Consistent With ACS

brief_summary.textblock: A prospective multi-centre observational study to validate the diagnostic accuracy of a transportable magnetocardiograph device for acute coronary syndrome (ACS), focusing on rule-out capability, in patients who present to the emergency department with chest pain symptoms consistent with ACS.

clinical_study.why_stopped: A correction needs to be made to the device's algorithm.

primary_outcome.description: Sensitivity and specificity for diagnosing ACS, focusing on rule-out, in chest pain patients with normal sinus rhythm

secondary_outcome.measure: Proportion of adverse events and types
All-cause mortatility (divided into CV and non-CV causes) proportion
3.Change in sensitivity and specificity for diagnosing ACS, focusing on rule-out, in chest pain patients with normal sinus rhythm, according to low, intermediate and high PTP groups
MACE post-presentation to the ED (rule-out of ACS divided into MCG vs reference standard (adjudicated ACS/non-ACS diagnoses))

arm_group.arm_group_label: Chest pain patients presenting to the ED
arm_group.description: All patients that present to the emergency department with chest pain and potentially other symptoms consistent with ACS and meet all eligibility criteria will undergo VitalScan Magnetocardiograph.

intervention.description: A passive, non-contact, mobile medical device that measures, displays, stores, and retrieves magnetic fluctuations caused by heart activity at a patient's bedside.
intervention.arm_group_label: Chest pain patients presenting to the ED

study_pop.textblock: All patients that present to the ED with chest pain syndrome of suspected cardiac origin (i.e. symptoms consistent with ACS) who are in normal sinus rhythm

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patient presents to the ED with chest pain syndrome of suspected cardiac origin (i.e. symptoms consistent with ACS)
- 18+ year old male or female
- Patient is willing and able to give written informed consent
Exclusion Criteria:
- ST-segment Elevation MI (STEMI)
- Clear non-ischemic cause for symptoms (e.g. trauma)
- Hemodynamic instability on admission (e.g. BP>220mmHg systolic & >110mmHg diastolic, <80mmHg systolic & <40mmHg diastolic, HR>160bpm)
- Ventricular tachycardia or fibrillation that cannot be treated effectively
- Atrial fibrillation
- Thoracic metal implants
- Pacemaker or internal defibrillator
- Pregnancy (if after 20-week period)* or lactation
- Patient unable to lie down (i.e. supine position) or stay still on the examination bed
- Patient unable to understand the informed consent process and/or has a poor understanding of English (e.g. English- speaking relative/translator not available)
- Patient unable to comply with the requirements of the protocol
